intro: Conophytum minutum var. sellatum, commonly known as the miniature conophytum, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its small, fleshy, and often spiky leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid climates. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange during the warmer months. Due to its compact size and unique appearance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor collections.
